alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 1:58PM CDT until April 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY FRIDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING... ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY SATURDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING IN PORTIONS OF CENTRAL, NORTH CENTRAL AND THE EASTERN NEBRASKA SANDHILLS... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 206, 210, AND 219... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 206 Sandhills/Valentine NWR/Nebraska National Forest, Fire Weather Zone 209 Loup Rivers Basin, Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin and Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * TIMING...From 1 PM CT (Noon MT) through 8 PM CT (7 PM MT) Friday. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...15 to 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower to middle 60s. * IMPACTS...Any fires which may develop, have a high probability for rapid spread and will be difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest
